Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en:
The history of discovering of folklore by the European thought, collecting of
folklore in Russia, the general problems of folklore-studies (folklore and a myth,
folklore and the literature, a problem of chronology and area variabilities in
folklore) are described in the course. Both the review of the basic types/genres
of Russian folklore, and the description of calendar cycles are given. The pactical
part of the course is devoted to the analysis of folklore/postfolklore texts of
different genres.
description.et: Loengutes käsitletakse rahvaluule avastamist Euroopa mõtlejate poolt, folkloori kogumist Venemaal, folkloristika üldisi probleeme (folkloor ja müüt, folkloor ja kirjandus, kronoloogia ja piirkondliku variatiivsuse probleem rahvaluules). Antakse ülevaade vene folkloori peamistest tüüpidest ning žanritest, kirjeldatakse kalendritsükleid. Kursuse praktiline pool on pühendatud erinevatesse žanritesse kuuluvate tekstide analüüsile.

objectives.en:
The basic purpose of the course is to give the notice about specificity of Russian folklore and
postfolklore, their basic types, genres and cycles.
objectives.et: Anda ülevaade vene rahvaluule ja postfolkloori ning selle erinevate tüüpide žanrite ja tsüklite spetsiifikast.

learning_outcomes.en: After completing the course the student
1) has the general knowledge about the specificity of folklore;
2) gets acquainted with history of Russian folklore-studies;
3) has notion about the basic genres of Russian traditional folklore;
learning_outcomes.et: 3) omab ülevaadet vene traditsioonilise folkloori peamistest žanritest;

learning_outcomes.en: 4) understands calendar cycles of Russian folklore;
learning_outcomes.et: 4) on tuttav vene rahvaluule kalendaarsete tsüklitega;

learning_outcomes.en: 5) knows about postfolklore in Russia and its basic genres.
learning_outcomes.et: 5) omab ettekujutust postfolkloorist ning selle peamistest žanritest Venemaal.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
